channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: North Korean Photo Reveals 'U.S. Mainland Strike Plan'
item.description: In a photo published in the Korea Worker’s Party paper plans for a strike on the U.S. mainland are clearly –and therefore probably deliberately– visible.

item.title: Weight Of The World
item.description: The average body mass index (BMI) values for adults around the globe compared.

item.title: A Shocking Number Of Americans Think Jesus Is Coming Back Really Soon
item.description: Christian views in America on the return of Christ.

item.title: This Is The Best Military Photography Of The Year
item.description: The photographers and videographers employed by the U.S. armed forces are often some pretty talented artists. Here's their best work from the past year.

item.title: Cops Ineptly Pretending To Be Punk Rockers On The Internet
item.description: The Boston police go undercover on the Internet to stop the city’s most dreaded scourge: DIY indie-rock shows.

item.title: FireMe! Site Exposes People Tweeting Horrible Things About Their Jobs
item.description: Like some previous attempts at scaring the pants off social media users, the FireMe! site offers a tool that allows you to “check yourself” to see what your firing potential is, based on your own inappropriate tweets.

item.title: From The Stone Age To The Digital Age In One Big Leap
item.description: Deep in the Amazon, an isolated Brazilian tribe almost vanished when it first had contact with the modern world. Now, the Surui tribe may be the most technology-savvy tribe in the Amazon.

item.title: How Obama Decided God Was OK With Marriage Equality
item.description: The last great mystery of Obama’s marriage shift.

item.title: Filipino Man Crucified For 27th Time Takes Good Friday Seriously
item.description: To many around the world, Good Friday is the start of a three-day weekend or a bitchin’ Black Crowes song. To strict devotees in the Philippines’ Pampanga province, it’s a chance to reenact crucifixion of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Soviet Ghost Town In The Czech Republic
item.description: There’s a little bit of the Soviet empire left in the middle of the Czech Republic, but it’s abandoned, decaying, and almost completely forgotten.

item.title: What Was It Like To Be A Writer On A TGIF Comedy?
item.description: What was it like to work on an ABC family comedy during the eighties and nineties? Vulture tracked down five veteran scribes from the Age of TGIF and asked them to bare their souls.

item.title: Man Charged With Hunting Deer In A Walmart Parking Lot
item.description: Arcangelo Bianco Jr. wasn’t at Walmart to hunt for bargains. Instead, the Pennsylvania man has been charged with hunting deer in the parking lot of the super store, the Indiana Gazette reports this week.

item.title: Enormous Storm Spans The Width Of The Atlantic Ocean
item.description: This incredible storm stretches from Newfoundland to Portugal and is as intense as a category 3 hurricane.

item.title: Animals Dressed Like Humans
item.description: "Zoo Portraits" is a funny photo series by Barcelona-based photographer Yago Partal that pairs animal heads with human bodies.

item.title: Barbara Walters To Retire—Really
item.description: After nearly 60 years of groundbreaking television, the ABC icon is reportedly stepping down in May 2014. A talk with Dan Rather, Mika Brzezinski, Connie Chung, and other colleagues who are in shock.

item.title: Google's Self-Driving Robot Cars Are Ruining My Commute
item.description: Away from the general unease they stir up, the Google self-driving cars come with very real consequences.

item.title: The One Woman Screwing Up North Dakota's Plan To End Abortion
item.description: She's the only abortion provider in a state that just passed crazy restrictions. And she’s not backing down.

item.title: How Mud Found Off A Tiny Japanese Island May Change The Gadget Economy
item.description: Japanese geologists have found a cache of rare earth elements buried in high concentrations in sea mud.

item.title: Watch This Magnetic Putty Absorb A Block
item.description: Here's a time lapse of magnetic putty as it absorbs a rare-earth magnet.

item.title: The Mind-Bending Enemy Within
item.description: Truth is stranger than fiction when it comes to the extraordinary abilities of parasites to hijack other creatures minds... including our own.

item.title: How Far-Right Extremists Recruit On The Internet
item.description: It’s not hard to find extremists on the internet. But it’s really hard finding out who’s the most successful at spreading extremism, which can make counteracting their influence difficult.

item.title: All The Cool Japanese Schoolgirls Are Recreating 'Dragon Ball' Fights
item.description: Even if you didn’t while away the hours in middle school by watching episode after episode of Dragon Ball while the world happened outside, you probably know what the “Kamehameha” attack looks like, even if you don’t realize it.

item.title: Game Developers Conference Features Sexy Dancing Ladies
item.description: Last night, the International Game Developer's Association (IGDA) threw a party, which featured scantily clad female dancers gyrating around a stage.

item.title: Art Stolen For Art's Sake
item.description: Adam Parker Smith has a gallery opening today, but none of the pieces are his.

item.title: Humans Are Speeding Up Evolution
item.description: Turns out evolution isn't always slow. Scientists in Nebraska have discovered a bird evolving right before our eyes.

item.title: Game Buried In Nevada Desert Will Launch Window In About 2,700 Years
item.description: Jason Rohrer's latest creation, a board game titled A Game for Someone, is currently buried somewhere in a Nevada desert where Rohrer intends it to stay for the next 2,700 years.

item.title: Mysterious New Virus Deadlier Than SARS Discovered
item.description: Mysterious coronavirus, though not less infectious, has a higher mortality rate and infects many species, Hong Kong researchers find

item.title: This Beautiful Mexico City Building Eats The City’s Smog
item.description: Using a new type of tile that converts the chemicals in pollution into less toxic substances, the Torre de Especialidadesis is fighting the city’s bad air--and looking good in the process.

item.title: Ghost-Hunting Basquiat In His Old East Village Apartment
item.description: Jean-Michel Basquiat’s “ex-girlfriend” has been hiding a trove of previously-unseen artifacts for thirty years in the apartment they shared in 1979-80. Now there's an avalanche of non-art media piling at her doorstep who all want to see a mural, a radiator and a door.

item.title: This Massive Jellyfish Is Really An Aquatic Spy Robot
item.description: This five-and-a-half-foot robot jellyfish could be the future of Navy underwater surveillance. Seriously. Maybe. Certainly, if a team of engineers from Virginia Tech gets its way.

item.title: China's One-Child Policy: Corpse Brides And Forced Abortions
item.description: China's one-child policy has created a long list of horrors that, besides child trafficking, includes infanticide, infant abandonment, and forced abortions, all used by families desperate to meet the set child quotas.
